c74object.name: ta.meandiff
c74object.description: Calculate the mean difference between input numbers.

objarg.name: initial
objarg.description: If turned off (zero) ta.meandiffz will only consider difference calculations when at least two input numbers are received. If turned on (non-zero) ta.meandiff calculates the difference for the first input number from the initially set value (see "set" message). (default = 1)

objarg.name: initial-difference
objarg.description: Sets the initial value from which to calcaluate the difference when the first input number is provided. This only takes effect if the "initial" attribute is set to "1". (default = 0.)

method.name: int/float/list
method.description: The absolute (non-negative) value of the input is sent out the output.

method.name: set
method.description: Sets the initial value from which to calcaluate the difference when the first input number is provided. This only takes effect if the "initial" attribute is set to "1". (default = 0.)

method.name: clear
method.description: Resets mean object inside and sets the initial difference back to the last provided value (from "set" message or object's 2nd argument).

attribute.name: initial
attribute.description: If turned off (zero) ta.meandiff will only consider difference calculations when at least two input numbers are received. If turned on (non-zero) ta.meandiff calculates the difference for the first input number from the initially set value (see "set" message). (default = 1) Note that ta.meandiff will clear its memory when the "initial" attribute is set.

entry.name: float
entry.description: Out left outlet: The mean (average) difference value between numbers received up to that point.

entry.name: int
entry.description: Out right outlet: How many numbers have been included in the averaging process.
